sentence: Tableau Software ( DATA ) has had a turbulent year, with its current stock price more than 50% lower than than its January high of $94.30.
Despite the company reporting positive year-over-year growth in all three quarters of the current fiscal year, investor sentiment has remained mixed.
In the same period, the company's operating expenses have increased 41% over last year.
We have revised our price estimate for Tableau to $52, which is 15% higher than its current market price.
The company's research and development (R&D) expenses contribute 32% of its total expenses.
New offerings - and constant upgrades of existing offerings - have driven Tableau's R&D expenses which, in absolute dollar terms, have increased year over year.
Additionally, the integration of HyPer (acquired in March 2016) into the existing offerings and the launch of Tableau 10 has also impacted R&D expenses.
Despite the increase in R&D in absolute terms, as a percentage of revenues these expenses declined from 23.4% in 2012 to 21.7% in 2015.
For the first nine months of the current year, the company's R&D expenses were 25.6% of revenues, primarily driven by HyPer integration costs and the launch of Tableau 10.
Going forward, we expect R&D expenses to decline as a percentage of revenue, though they will likely continue to increase in dollar terms.
Going forward, as Tableau continues to mature and grow revenues, its R&D spend will likely decline as a percentage of revenue.

However, if the company continues to increase its R&D spend in order to upgrade its offerings and compete against traditional giants such as Microsoft and Salesforce, there could be a downside of around 17% to our price estimate for the company's stock.
